Activity: Arrive at the office, get coffee, and ease into the day by browsing social media.
Continue working on the scene featuring the antagonist-linked character. Polish the dialogue and add more emotional depth to the character's performance.
Get stuck on a particular scene transition. Email @Lvdn-1 to ask for their input on how the scene could transition to a different location or time period. Topic: Scene Transition Assistance

Take a break from writing and research different types of environmental storytelling techniques. Look for examples of how the environment can be used to convey information about the story and characters.
Brainstorm ideas for incorporating environmental storytelling into the game's levels. Think about how the environment can be used to hint at past events or foreshadow future events.
Lunch break. Try a new restaurant with some colleagues.
Received a response from @Lvdn-1, helpful suggestion. Implement it into my scene.
Complete the scene and send it to @Ldes-1 for review. Topic: Antagonist-Linked Character Scene - Review Request
Start working on a document outlining the game's main story beats. Focus on creating a clear and concise narrative structure that will guide the player through the game's story.
Wrap up the day by backing up my work and listening to a podcast.
